pageContext.claim: “The United States is the largest producer -- that's happened over the last short period of time -- of crude oil and natural gas in the world, surpassing Saudi Arabia and Russia. … And in a short period of time, as soon as we get some pipelines opened in Texas, we'll be able to almost double it. Double it.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. became the world's largest producer of natural gas in 2009. The Energy Information Administration said the U.S. likely became the world's largest oil producer in 2018; the International Energy Agency estimates that the U.S. will reach this milestone by 2023.
